intro: Podachaenium andinum, commonly known as the Andean podachaenium, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and distinctive, papery bracts. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
